title: Blinded
subtitle: You can't see
description: You have a total inability to see.
bullets: You automatically fail any d20 Test that requires sight.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.

title: Charmed
subtitle: You are charmed
description: You are charmed by another creature, the charmer.
bullets: You can't attack the charmer or target them with a harmful spell or ability.
The charmer has advantage on Charisma checks in social interaction with you.

title: Dazed
subtitle: You have limited activity
description: A new condition that limits what you can do on your turn.
bullets: You can take either an Action or a Bonus Action on your turn, but not both. You can still move and take a Reaction.
You cannot Concentrate on spells or other effects.

Design Intent: Dazed replaces 'Stun-locking' effects from many spells and monster abilities. It's less debilitating than Stunned but still highly disruptive, preventing a character from using their full action economy.

title: Deafened
subtitle: You can't hear
description: You have a total inability to hear.
bullets: You automatically fail any d20 Test that requires hearing.

title: Dying
subtitle: You are at 0 Hit Points
description: You are at 0 Hit Points and at risk of death.
bullets: When you drop to 0 HP, you become Unconscious and are Dying.
Death Saving Throws: At the start of each of your turns, make a Death Save (a d20 roll with no modifiers). On a 10 or higher, you score a success. On a 9 or lower, a failure.
3 Successes: You become Stable.
3 Failures: You die.
A Natural 1 counts as two failures. A Natural 20 means you regain 1 Hit Point.
Damage at 0 HP: Taking damage while at 0 HP causes one Death Save failure (two if the damage is from a critical hit).

title: Exhaustion
subtitle: You are exhausted
description: Exhaustion is measured in 10 levels. Each level gives a cumulative -1 penalty to all d20 Tests.
bullets: Penalty per Level: You suffer a cumulative -1 penalty to all d20 Tests (attack rolls, saving throws, ability checks) for each level of Exhaustion.
Level 5: Your Speed is halved.
Level 7: Your Speed becomes 0.
Level 10: You die.
Finishing a Long Rest removes 1 level of Exhaustion.

title: Frightened
subtitle: You are frightened
description: You are frightened of a source of fear.
bullets: You have disadvantage on d20 Tests while the source of your fear is within your line of sight.
You can't willingly move closer to the source of your fear.

title: Grappled
subtitle: You are grappled
description: You are held in a creature's grasp.
bullets: Your Speed becomes 0, and you can't benefit from any bonus to your Speed.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls against any creature other than the one grappling you.
The condition ends if the grappler is Incapacitated or if you are moved outside the grappler's reach.
You can attempt to escape with the Escape action.

title: Incapacitated
subtitle: You can't take actions
description: You can't take an Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction.
bullets: This is a component of several other conditions. It is a more severe version of Dazed.

title: Invisible
subtitle: You can't be seen
description: You are impossible to see without magic or a special sense.
bullets: For the purpose of hiding, you are Heavily Obscured.
You have advantage on attack rolls.
Attack rolls against you have disadvantage.

title: Paralyzed
subtitle: You are paralyzed
description: You are frozen, unable to move or act.
bullets: You are Incapacitated and can't move or speak.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.
Any attack that hits you is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.
You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

title: Petrified
subtitle: You are transformed into stone
description: You are transformed into a solid, inanimate substance.
bullets: You are Incapacitated, can't move or speak, and are unaware of your surroundings.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.
You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
You have resistance to all damage.
You are immune to poison and disease.
Your weight is multiplied by ten, and you stop aging.

title: Poisoned
subtitle: You are poisoned
description: A toxin is affecting you.
bullets: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

title: Prone
subtitle: You are prone
description: You are lying on the ground.
bullets: Your only movement option is to Crawl (which costs double movement) until you stand up.
Standing up costs half your Speed.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls.
An attack roll against you has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet. Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

title: Restrained
subtitle: You are restrained
description: You are held in place by a physical or magical effect.
bullets: Your Speed becomes 0, and you can't benefit from any bonus to your Speed.
You have disadvantage on attack rolls.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.
You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

title: Slowed
subtitle: Your movement is hindered
description: A new condition that impedes movement and reactions.
bullets: Your Speed is halved.
You have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
You can take either an Action or a Bonus Action on your turn, but not both.
You can't take the Disengage action.

Design Intent: Slowed is a powerful control condition that replaces many disparate effects in the 2014 rules. It's less severe than Stunned but more impactful on mobile characters than simply reducing speed.

title: Stunned
subtitle: You are stunned
description: You are overwhelmed and unable to act.
bullets: You are Incapacitated and can't move.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.
You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

title: Suffocating
subtitle: Holding your breath
description: A creature can hold its breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum 30 seconds). When it runs out of breath, it can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round). At the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying.
bullets: You can hold your breath for 1 + CON modifier minutes (min 30s).
When out of breath, you can survive for CON modifier rounds (min 1).
At the start of your next turn after that, you drop to 0 HP and are dying.
You cannot regain hit points or be stabilized until you can breathe again.

title: Unconscious
subtitle: You are unconscious
description: You are senseless and unaware.
bullets: You are Incapacitated, can't move or speak, and are unaware of your surroundings.
You drop whatever you're holding and fall Prone.
Attack rolls against you have advantage.
Any attack that hits you is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of you.
You automatically fail Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
If you are at 0 Hit Points, you are subject to the Dying rules.

title: Madness*
subtitle: Your mind is damaged
description: This optional rule system from the DMG introduces mental trauma with short-term, long-term, and indefinite effects.
bullets: (Optional Rule – DMG):
A character might suffer madness from traumatic events, such as failing a Sanity saving throw, seeing an aberration from the Far Realm, or from spells like Contact Other Plane.
Short-Term Madness (1d10 minutes): Effects like being stunned, becoming paralyzed with fear, or babbling incoherently.
Long-Term Madness (1d10 x 10 hours): Effects like developing a phobia, having hallucinations, or suffering from extreme paranoia.
Indefinite Madness: A permanent change to the character's personality or beliefs, curable only by powerful magic like Greater Restoration or Wish.
